attributes.action: Change the 100 year Secrecy Order Blair imposed on high profile paedophies
attributes.additional_details: Someone practicing paedophilia can not be considered as acting impartially in all areas.  It is also in the public interest to know who these people are and to what extent their involvement may have influenced their decision making.
attributes.background: Change the Secrecy Order on high profile paedophiles uncovered in the Operation Ore investigation of 2002 from 100 years to 5 years.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. There is no such 'secrecy order', however most personal information relating to law enforcement is subject to a 100 year restriction on publication. You can find out more here:

https://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/documents/information-management/access-to-public-records.pdf 
	
If you would like all police records to be made available sooner than 100 years, you could start a petition calling for that to happen.
